001// Copyright (c) Choreo contributors
002
003package choreo.auto;
004
005import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Alert.AlertType.kError;
006
007import choreo.Choreo.TrajectoryLogger;
008import choreo.auto.AutoFactory.AllianceContext;
009import choreo.auto.AutoFactory.AutoBindings;
010import choreo.trajectory.DifferentialSample;
011import choreo.trajectory.SwerveSample;
012import choreo.trajectory.Trajectory;
013import choreo.trajectory.TrajectorySample;
014import choreo.util.ChoreoAlert;
015import choreo.util.ChoreoAlert.MultiAlert;
016import choreo.util.ChoreoAllianceFlipUtil;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
019import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d;
020import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Alert;
021import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer;
022import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
023import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Commands;
024import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.FunctionalCommand;
025import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
026import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger;
027import java.util.Optional;
028import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
029import java.util.function.Consumer;
030import java.util.function.Supplier;
031
032/**
033 * A class that represents a trajectory that can be used in an autonomous routine and have triggers
034 * based off of it.
035 */
036public class AutoTrajectory {
037  // For any devs looking through this class wondering
038  // about all the type casting and `?` for generics it's intentional.
039  // My goal was to make the sample type minimally leak into user code
040  // so you don't have to retype the sample type everywhere in your auto
041  // code. This also makes the places with generics exposed to users few
042  // and far between. This helps with more novice users
043
044  private static final MultiAlert triggerTimeNegative =
045      ChoreoAlert.multiAlert(causes -> "Trigger time cannot be negative for " + causes, kError);
046  private static final MultiAlert triggerTimeAboveMax =
047      ChoreoAlert.multiAlert(
048          causes -> "Trigger time cannot be greater than total trajectory time for " + causes + ".",
049          kError);
050  private static final MultiAlert eventNotFound =
051      ChoreoAlert.multiAlert(causes -> "Event Markers " + causes + " not found.", kError);
052  private static final MultiAlert noSamples =
053      ChoreoAlert.multiAlert(causes -> "Trajectories " + causes + " have no samples.", kError);
054  private static final MultiAlert noInitialPose =
055      ChoreoAlert.multiAlert(
056          causes -> "Unable to get initial pose for trajectories " + causes + ".", kError);
057  private static final Alert allianceNotReady =
058      ChoreoAlert.alert("Alliance used but not ready", kError);
059
060  private final String name;
061  private final Trajectory<? extends TrajectorySample<?>> trajectory;
062  private final TrajectoryLogger<? extends TrajectorySample<?>> trajectoryLogger;
063  private final Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier;
064  private final Consumer<Pose2d> resetOdometry;
065  private final Consumer<? extends TrajectorySample<?>> controller;
066  private final AllianceContext allianceCtx;
067  private final Timer timer = new Timer();
068  private final Subsystem driveSubsystem;
069  private final AutoRoutine routine;
070
071  /**
072   * A way to create slightly less triggers for many actions. Not static as to not leak triggers
073   * made here into another static EventLoop.
074   */
075  private final Trigger offTrigger;
076
077  /** If this trajectory us currently running */
078  private boolean isActive = false;
079
080  /** If the trajectory ran to completion */
081  private boolean isCompleted = false;
082
083  /**
084   * Constructs an AutoTrajectory.
085   *
086   * @param name The trajectory name.
087   * @param trajectory The trajectory samples.
088   * @param poseSupplier The pose supplier.
089   * @param controller The controller function.
090   * @param allianceCtx The alliance context.
091   * @param trajectoryLogger Optional trajectory logger.
092   * @param driveSubsystem Drive subsystem.
093   * @param routine Event loop.
094   * @param bindings {@link AutoFactory}
095   */
096  <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoTrajectory(
097      String name,
098      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory,
099      Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier,
100      Consumer<Pose2d> resetOdometry,
101      Consumer<SampleType> controller,
102      AllianceContext allianceCtx,
103      TrajectoryLogger<SampleType> trajectoryLogger,
104      Subsystem driveSubsystem,
105      AutoRoutine routine,
106      AutoBindings bindings) {
107    this.name = name;
108    this.trajectory = trajectory;
109    this.poseSupplier = poseSupplier;
110    this.resetOdometry = resetOdometry;
111    this.controller = controller;
112    this.allianceCtx = allianceCtx;
113    this.driveSubsystem = driveSubsystem;
114    this.routine = routine;
115    this.offTrigger = new Trigger(routine.loop(), () -> false);
116    this.trajectoryLogger = trajectoryLogger;
117
118    bindings.getBindings().forEach((key, value) -> active().and(atTime(key)).onTrue(value));
119  }
120
121  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
122  private void logTrajectory(boolean starting) {
123    var sampleOpt = trajectory.getInitialSample(false);
124    if (sampleOpt.isEmpty()) {
125      return;
126    }
127    var sample = sampleOpt.get();
128    if (sample instanceof SwerveSample) {
129      TrajectoryLogger<SwerveSample> swerveLogger =
130          (TrajectoryLogger<SwerveSample>) trajectoryLogger;
131      Trajectory<SwerveSample> swerveTrajectory = (Trajectory<SwerveSample>) trajectory;
132      swerveLogger.accept(swerveTrajectory, starting);
133    } else if (sample instanceof DifferentialSample) {
134      TrajectoryLogger<DifferentialSample> differentialLogger =
135          (TrajectoryLogger<DifferentialSample>) trajectoryLogger;
136      Trajectory<DifferentialSample> differentialTrajectory =
137          (Trajectory<DifferentialSample>) trajectory;
138      differentialLogger.accept(differentialTrajectory, starting);
139    }
140    ;
141  }
142
143  private void cmdInitialize() {
144    timer.restart();
145    isActive = true;
146    isCompleted = false;
147    logTrajectory(true);
148  }
149
150  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
151  private void cmdExecute() {
152    if (!allianceCtx.allianceKnownOrIgnored()) {
153      allianceNotReady.set(true);
154      return;
155    }
156    var sampleOpt = trajectory.sampleAt(timer.get(), allianceCtx.doFlip());
157    if (sampleOpt.isEmpty()) {
158      return;
159    }
160    var sample = sampleOpt.get();
161    if (sample instanceof SwerveSample swerveSample) {
162      var swerveController = (Consumer<SwerveSample>) this.controller;
163      swerveController.accept(swerveSample);
164    } else if (sample instanceof DifferentialSample differentialSample) {
165      var differentialController = (Consumer<DifferentialSample>) this.controller;
166      differentialController.accept(differentialSample);
167    }
168  }
169
170  private void cmdEnd(boolean interrupted) {
171    timer.stop();
172    isActive = false;
173    isCompleted = !interrupted;
174    cmdExecute(); // will force the controller to be fed the final sample
175    logTrajectory(false);
176  }
177
178  private boolean cmdIsFinished() {
179    return timer.get() > trajectory.getTotalTime() || !routine.active().getAsBoolean();
180  }
181
182  /**
183   * Creates a command that allocates the drive subsystem and follows the trajectory using the
184   * factories control function
185   *
186   * @return The command that will follow the trajectory
187   */
188  public Command cmd() {
189    // if the trajectory is empty, return a command that will print an error
190    if (trajectory.samples().isEmpty()) {
191      return driveSubsystem.runOnce(() -> noSamples.addCause(name)).withName("Trajectory_" + name);
192    }
193    return new FunctionalCommand(
194            this::cmdInitialize,
195            this::cmdExecute,
196            this::cmdEnd,
197            this::cmdIsFinished,
198            driveSubsystem)
199        .withName("Trajectory_" + name);
200  }
201
202  /**
203   * Creates a command that resets the robot's odometry to the start of this trajectory.
204   *
205   * @return A command that resets the robot's odometry.
206   */
207  public Command resetOdometry() {
208    return Commands.either(
209            Commands.runOnce(() -> resetOdometry.accept(getInitialPose().get()), driveSubsystem),
210            Commands.runOnce(
211                    () -> {
212                      noInitialPose.addCause(name);
213                      routine.kill();
214                    })
215                .andThen(driveSubsystem.run(() -> {})),
216            () -> getInitialPose().isPresent())
217        .withName("Trajectory_ResetOdometry_" + name);
218  }
219
220  /**
221   * Will get the underlying {@link Trajectory} object.
222   *
223   * <p><b>WARNING:</b> This method is not type safe and should be used with caution. The sample
224   * type of the trajectory should be known before calling this method.
225   *
226   * @param <SampleType> The type of the trajectory samples.
227   * @return The underlying {@link Trajectory} object.
228   */
229  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
230  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>>
231      Trajectory<SampleType> getRawTrajectory() {
232    return (Trajectory<SampleType>) trajectory;
233  }
234
235  /**
236   * Will get the starting pose of the trajectory.
237   *
238   * <p>This position is flipped if alliance flipping is enabled and the alliance supplier returns
239   * Red.
240   *
241   * <p>This method returns an empty Optional if the trajectory is empty. This method returns an
242   * empty Optional if alliance flipping is enabled and the alliance supplier returns an empty
243   * Optional.
244   *
245   * @return The starting pose
246   */
247  public Optional<Pose2d> getInitialPose() {
248    if (!allianceCtx.allianceKnownOrIgnored()) {
249      allianceNotReady.set(true);
250      return Optional.empty();
251    }
252    return trajectory.getInitialPose(allianceCtx.doFlip());
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Will get the ending pose of the trajectory.
257   *
258   * <p>This position is flipped if alliance flipping is enabled and the alliance supplier returns
259   * Red.
260   *
261   * <p>This method returns an empty Optional if the trajectory is empty. This method returns an
262   * empty Optional if alliance flipping is enabled and the alliance supplier returns an empty
263   * Optional.
264   *
265   * @return The starting pose
266   */
267  public Optional<Pose2d> getFinalPose() {
268    if (!allianceCtx.allianceKnownOrIgnored()) {
269      allianceNotReady.set(true);
270      return Optional.empty();
271    }
272    return trajectory.getFinalPose(allianceCtx.doFlip());
273  }
274
275  /**
276   * Returns a trigger that is true while the trajectory is scheduled.
277   *
278   * @return A trigger that is true while the trajectory is scheduled.
279   */
280  public Trigger active() {
281    return new Trigger(routine.loop(), () -> this.isActive && routine.active().getAsBoolean());
282  }
283
284  /**
285   * Returns a trigger that is true while the command is not scheduled.
286   *
287   * <p>The same as calling <code>active().negate()</code>.
288   *
289   * @return A trigger that is true while the command is not scheduled.
290   */
291  public Trigger inactive() {
292    return active().negate();
293  }
294
295  /**
296   * Returns a trigger that rises to true when the trajectory ends and falls after one pulse.
297   *
298   * <p>This is different from inactive() in a few ways.
299   *
300   * <ul>
301   *   <li>This will never be true if the trajectory is interrupted
302   *   <li>This will never be true before the trajectory is run
303   *   <li>This will fall the next cycle after the trajectory ends
304   * </ul>
305   *
306   * <p>Why does the trigger need to fall?
307   *
308   * <pre><code>
309   * //Lets say we had this code segment
310   * Trigger hasGamepiece = ...;
311   * Trigger noGamepiece = hasGamepiece.negate();
312   *
313   * AutoTrajectory rushMidTraj = ...;
314   * AutoTrajectory goShootGamepiece = ...;
315   * AutoTrajectory pickupAnotherGamepiece = ...;
316   *
317   * routine.enabled().onTrue(rushMidTraj.cmd());
318   *
319   * rushMidTraj.done(10).and(noGamepiece).onTrue(pickupAnotherGamepiece.cmd());
320   * rushMidTraj.done(10).and(hasGamepiece).onTrue(goShootGamepiece.cmd());
321   *
322   * // If done never falls when a new trajectory is scheduled
323   * // then these triggers leak into the next trajectory, causing the next note pickup
324   * // to trigger goShootGamepiece.cmd() even if we no longer care about these checks
325   * </code></pre>
326   *
327   * @param cyclesToDelay The number of cycles to delay the trigger from rising to true.
328   * @return A trigger that is true when the trajectory is finished.
329   */
330  public Trigger done(int cyclesToDelay) {
331    BooleanSupplier checker =
332        new BooleanSupplier() {
333          /** The last used value for trajectory completeness */
334          boolean lastCompleteness = false;
335
336          /** The cycle to be true for */
337          int cycleTarget = -1;
338
339          @Override
340          public boolean getAsBoolean() {
341            if (!isCompleted) {
342              // update last seen value
343              lastCompleteness = false;
344              return false;
345            }
346            if (!lastCompleteness && isCompleted) {
347              // if just flipped to completed update last seen value
348              // and store the cycleTarget based of the current cycle
349              lastCompleteness = true;
350              cycleTarget = routine.pollCount() + cyclesToDelay;
351            }
352            // finally if check the cycle matches the target
353            return routine.pollCount() == cycleTarget;
354          }
355        };
356    return inactive().and(new Trigger(routine.loop(), checker));
357  }
358
359  /**
360   * Returns a trigger that rises to true when the trajectory ends and falls after one pulse.
361   *
362   * <p>This is different from inactive() in a few ways.
363   *
364   * <ul>
365   *   <li>This will never be true if the trajectory is interrupted
366   *   <li>This will never be true before the trajectory is run
367   *   <li>This will fall the next cycle after the trajectory ends
368   * </ul>
369   *
370   * <p>Why does the trigger need to fall?
371   *
372   * <pre><code>
373   * //Lets say we had this code segment
374   * Trigger hasGamepiece = ...;
375   * Trigger noGamepiece = hasGamepiece.negate();
376   *
377   * AutoTrajectory rushMidTraj = ...;
378   * AutoTrajectory goShootGamepiece = ...;
379   * AutoTrajectory pickupAnotherGamepiece = ...;
380   *
381   * routine.enabled().onTrue(rushMidTraj.cmd());
382   *
383   * rushMidTraj.done().and(noGamepiece).onTrue(pickupAnotherGamepiece.cmd());
384   * rushMidTraj.done().and(hasGamepiece).onTrue(goShootGamepiece.cmd());
385   *
386   * // If done never falls when a new trajectory is scheduled
387   * // then these triggers leak into the next trajectory, causing the next note pickup
388   * // to trigger goShootGamepiece.cmd() even if we no longer care about these checks
389   * </code></pre>
390   *
391   * @return A trigger that is true when the trajectory is finished.
392   */
393  public Trigger done() {
394    return done(0);
395  }
396
397  /**
398   * Returns a trigger that will go true for 1 cycle when the desired time has elapsed
399   *
400   * @param timeSinceStart The time since the command started in seconds.
401   * @return A trigger that is true when timeSinceStart has elapsed.
402   */
403  public Trigger atTime(double timeSinceStart) {
404    // The timer should never be negative so report this as a warning
405    if (timeSinceStart < 0) {
406      triggerTimeNegative.addCause(name);
407      return offTrigger;
408    }
409
410    // The timer should never exceed the total trajectory time so report this as a warning
411    if (timeSinceStart > trajectory.getTotalTime()) {
412      triggerTimeAboveMax.addCause(name);
413      return offTrigger;
414    }
415
416    // Make the trigger only be high for 1 cycle when the time has elapsed,
417    // this is needed for better support of multi-time triggers for multi events
418    return new Trigger(
419        routine.loop(),
420        new BooleanSupplier() {
421          double lastTimestamp = timer.get();
422
423          public boolean getAsBoolean() {
424            double nowTimestamp = timer.get();
425            try {
426              return lastTimestamp < nowTimestamp && nowTimestamp >= timeSinceStart;
427            } finally {
428              lastTimestamp = nowTimestamp;
429            }
430          }
431        });
432  }
433
434  /**
435   * Returns a trigger that is true when the event with the given name has been reached based on
436   * time.
437   *
438   * <p>A warning will be printed to the DriverStation if the event is not found and the trigger
439   * will always be false.
440   *
441   * @param eventName The name of the event.
442   * @return A trigger that is true when the event with the given name has been reached based on
443   *     time.
444   * @see <a href="https://choreo.autos/usage/editing-paths/#event-markers">Event Markers in the
445   *     GUI</a>
446   */
447  public Trigger atTime(String eventName) {
448    boolean foundEvent = false;
449    Trigger trig = offTrigger;
450
451    for (var event : trajectory.getEvents(eventName)) {
452      // This could create a lot of objects, could be done a more efficient way
453      // with having it all be 1 trigger that just has a list of times and checks each one each
454      // cycle
455      // or something like that. If choreo starts proposing memory issues we can look into this.
456      trig = trig.or(atTime(event.timestamp));
457      foundEvent = true;
458    }
459
460    // The user probably expects an event to exist if they're trying to do something at that event,
461    // report the missing event.
462    if (!foundEvent) {
463      eventNotFound.addCause(name);
464    }
465
466    return trig;
467  }
468
469  private boolean withinTolerance(Rotation2d lhs, Rotation2d rhs, double toleranceRadians) {
470    if (Math.abs(toleranceRadians) > Math.PI) {
471      return true;
472    }
473    double dot = lhs.getCos() * rhs.getCos() + lhs.getSin() * rhs.getSin();
474    // cos(θ) >= cos(tolerance) means |θ| <= tolerance, for tolerance in [-pi, pi], as pre-checked
475    // above.
476    return dot > Math.cos(toleranceRadians);
477  }
478
479  /**
480   * Returns a trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given pose.
481   *
482   * <p>The pose is flipped if alliance flipping is enabled and the alliance supplier returns Red.
483   *
484   * <p>While alliance flipping is enabled and the alliance supplier returns empty, the trigger will
485   * return false.
486   *
487   * @param pose The pose to check against, unflipped.
488   * @param toleranceMeters The tolerance in meters.
489   * @param toleranceRadians The heading tolerance in radians.
490   * @return A trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given pose.
491   */
492  public Trigger atPose(Pose2d pose, double toleranceMeters, double toleranceRadians) {
493    Pose2d flippedPose = ChoreoAllianceFlipUtil.flip(pose);
494    return new Trigger(
495            routine.loop(),
496            () -> {
497              if (allianceCtx.allianceKnownOrIgnored()) {
498                final Pose2d currentPose = poseSupplier.get();
499                if (allianceCtx.doFlip()) {
500                  boolean transValid =
501                      currentPose.getTranslation().getDistance(flippedPose.getTranslation())
502                          < toleranceMeters;
503                  boolean rotValid =
504                      withinTolerance(
505                          currentPose.getRotation(), flippedPose.getRotation(), toleranceRadians);
506                  return transValid && rotValid;
507                } else {
508                  boolean transValid =
509                      currentPose.getTranslation().getDistance(pose.getTranslation())
510                          < toleranceMeters;
511                  boolean rotValid =
512                      withinTolerance(
513                          currentPose.getRotation(), pose.getRotation(), toleranceRadians);
514                  return transValid && rotValid;
515                }
516              } else {
517                allianceNotReady.set(true);
518                return false;
519              }
520            })
521        .and(active());
522  }
523
524  /**
525   * Returns a trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters and toleranceRadians of
526   * the given event's pose.
527   *
528   * <p>A warning will be printed to the DriverStation if the event is not found and the trigger
529   * will always be false.
530   *
531   * @param eventName The name of the event.
532   * @param toleranceMeters The tolerance in meters.
533   * @param toleranceRadians The heading tolerance in radians.
534   * @return A trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given events
535   *     pose.
536   * @see <a href="https://choreo.autos/usage/editing-paths/#event-markers">Event Markers in the
537   *     GUI</a>
538   */
539  public Trigger atPose(String eventName, double toleranceMeters, double toleranceRadians) {
540    boolean foundEvent = false;
541    Trigger trig = offTrigger;
542
543    for (var event : trajectory.getEvents(eventName)) {
544      // This could create a lot of objects, could be done a more efficient way
545      // with having it all be 1 trigger that just has a list of possess and checks each one each
546      // cycle or something like that.
547      // If choreo starts showing memory issues we can look into this.
548      Optional<Pose2d> poseOpt =
549          trajectory
550              // don't mirror here because the poses are mirrored themselves
551              // this also lets atPose be called before the alliance is ready
552              .sampleAt(event.timestamp, false)
553              .map(TrajectorySample::getPose);
554      if (poseOpt.isPresent()) {
555        trig = trig.or(atPose(poseOpt.get(), toleranceMeters, toleranceRadians));
556        foundEvent = true;
557      }
558    }
559
560    // The user probably expects an event to exist if they're trying to do something at that event,
561    // report the missing event.
562    if (!foundEvent) {
563      eventNotFound.addCause(name);
564    }
565
566    return trig;
567  }
568
569  /**
570   * Returns a trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given
571   * translation.
572   *
573   * <p>The translation is flipped if alliance flipping is enabled and the alliance supplier returns
574   * Red.
575   *
576   * <p>While alliance flipping is enabled and the alliance supplier returns empty, the trigger will
577   * return false.
578   *
579   * @param translation The translation to check against, unflipped.
580   * @param toleranceMeters The tolerance in meters.
581   * @return A trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given
582   *     translation.
583   */
584  public Trigger atTranslation(Translation2d translation, double toleranceMeters) {
585    Translation2d flippedTranslation = ChoreoAllianceFlipUtil.flip(translation);
586    return new Trigger(
587            routine.loop(),
588            () -> {
589              if (allianceCtx.allianceKnownOrIgnored()) {
590                final Translation2d currentTrans = poseSupplier.get().getTranslation();
591                if (allianceCtx.doFlip()) {
592                  return currentTrans.getDistance(flippedTranslation) < toleranceMeters;
593                } else {
594                  return currentTrans.getDistance(translation) < toleranceMeters;
595                }
596              } else {
597                allianceNotReady.set(true);
598                return false;
599              }
600            })
601        .and(active());
602  }
603
604  /**
605   * Returns a trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters and toleranceRadians of
606   * the given event's translation.
607   *
608   * <p>A warning will be printed to the DriverStation if the event is not found and the trigger
609   * will always be false.
610   *
611   * @param eventName The name of the event.
612   * @param toleranceMeters The tolerance in meters.
613   * @return A trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given events
614   *     translation.
615   * @see <a href="https://choreo.autos/usage/editing-paths/#event-markers">Event Markers in the
616   *     GUI</a>
617   */
618  public Trigger atTranslation(String eventName, double toleranceMeters) {
619    boolean foundEvent = false;
620    Trigger trig = offTrigger;
621
622    for (var event : trajectory.getEvents(eventName)) {
623      // This could create a lot of objects, could be done a more efficient way
624      // with having it all be 1 trigger that just has a list of poses and checks each one each
625      // cycle or something like that.
626      // If choreo starts showing memory issues we can look into this.
627      Optional<Translation2d> translationOpt =
628          trajectory
629              // don't mirror here because the translations are mirrored themselves
630              // this also lets atTranslation be called before the alliance is ready
631              .sampleAt(event.timestamp, false)
632              .map(TrajectorySample::getPose)
633              .map(Pose2d::getTranslation);
634      if (translationOpt.isPresent()) {
635        trig = trig.or(atTranslation(translationOpt.get(), toleranceMeters));
636        foundEvent = true;
637      }
638    }
639
640    // The user probably expects an event to exist if they're trying to do something at that event,
641    // report the missing event.
642    if (!foundEvent) {
643      eventNotFound.addCause(name);
644    }
645
646    return trig;
647  }
648
649  /**
650   * Returns an array of all the timestamps of the events with the given name.
651   *
652   * @param eventName The name of the event.
653   * @return An array of all the timestamps of the events with the given name.
654   * @see <a href="https://choreo.autos/usage/editing-paths/#event-markers">Event Markers in the
655   *     GUI</a>
656   */
657  public double[] collectEventTimes(String eventName) {
658    double[] times =
659        trajectory.getEvents(eventName).stream()
660            .filter(e -> e.timestamp >= 0 && e.timestamp <= trajectory.getTotalTime())
661            .mapToDouble(e -> e.timestamp)
662            .toArray();
663
664    if (times.length == 0) {
665      eventNotFound.addCause("collectEvents(" + eventName + ")");
666    }
667
668    return times;
669  }
670
671  /**
672   * Returns an array of all the poses of the events with the given name.
673   *
674   * <p>The returned poses are always unflipped. If you use them in a trigger like `atPose` or
675   * `atTranslation`, the library will automatically flip them if necessary. If you intend using
676   * them in a different context, you can use {@link ChoreoAllianceFlipUtil#flip} to flip them.
677   *
678   * @param eventName The name of the event.
679   * @return An array of all the poses of the events with the given name.
680   * @see <a href="https://choreo.autos/usage/editing-paths/#event-markers">Event Markers in the
681   *     GUI</a>
682   */
683  public Pose2d[] collectEventPoses(String eventName) {
684    double[] times = collectEventTimes(eventName);
685    Pose2d[] poses = new Pose2d[times.length];
686    for (int i = 0; i < times.length; i++) {
687      Pose2d pose =
688          trajectory
689              .sampleAt(times[i], false)
690              .map(TrajectorySample::getPose)
691              .get(); // the event times are guaranteed to be valid
692      poses[i] = pose;
693    }
694    return poses;
695  }
696
697  @Override
698  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
699    return obj instanceof AutoTrajectory traj && name.equals(traj.name);
700  }
701}
